results.title: Freaks
results.brief_description: This controversial film was banned for over thirty years in some countries, including Australia. Using a group of circus and carnival performers who were all regarded as “freaks of nature” this unsettling film is about a malicious young woman who weds a carnival manager in order to gain his wealth. Her cruel treatment of the various circus performers prompts them to exact a vicious revenge. The final scenes in this movie are possibly some of the most harrowing in horror cinema history.

results.title: Performance
results.creator_credit: Nicolas Roeg, Donald Cammell, Sanford Lieberson, Goodtime Enterprises and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: James Fox is Chas, a working-class London hitman, who is violent, cunning and ruthless. His growing arrogance results in a murder which sets his gangster boss against him. On the run, and fearing for his life, Chas holes up in the basement apartment of an ex-rock star (Mick Jagger) who lives with his two bisexual girlfriends (Anita Pallenberg & Michele Breton). The two men experience an initial repulsion then increasing fascination with each other, and under the influence of hallucinogenic drugs, they begin slowly to merge personas. This startling, original film uses the techniques and experiments of underground cinema to investigate the dislocation suffered by both bourgeois and working-class sexualities when confronted by the permissiveness of the hippie subculture. Fox, hard and masculine, and Jagger, soft and androgynous, both give two superb homoerotic performances. The electric rock score includes original music by Mick Jagger, The Last Poets and Ry Cooder.

results.title: Whore
results.creator_credit: Ken Russell, Ronaldo Vasconcellos, Dan Ireland and Trimark Pictures
results.brief_description: Whore tells the story of one night in the life of a prostitute. Liz, (Theresa Russell) is a street wise hooker who has seen it all and done it all. In contrast to “Pretty Woman”, this film does not glamorise prostitution. This is a brash, vulgar depiction of the profession. Although exploitative and titillating in itself, it does raise issues often overlooked in more romantic interpretations, including legalisation, safe sex, drug abuse and the relationship between sex and power.

results.title: Dead reckoning
results.creator_credit: John Cromwell, Sidney Biddell and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Humphrey Bogart is at his best as a hard-boiled sleuth in this ‘40s film noir classic. He plays Rip Murdock, an ex-GI trying to discover who framed his pal, Johnny, for murder and then rubbed him out. Tracing his war buddy’s shadowy past leads Rip to Coral Chandler (Lizabeth Scott), who was once Johnny’s sweetheart and is now a chanteuse in a nightclub run by a brutal gangster, Martinelli (Morris Carnovsky). Rip gets a taste of the beautiful blonde’s seductive charms and soon finds himself ensnared in a twisted web of deceit and danger.

results.title: The Greatest story ever told
results.creator_credit: George Stevens and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: With one of the finest film casts ever assembled, this epic has been hailed as the definitive screen version of the life and times of Jesus Christ. As Jesus, the internationally acclaimed Max Von Sydow reveals the compassion, anguish and glory of the “King of the Jews” in the performance of a lifetime. The distinguished ensemble cast also features Charlton Heston as John the Baptist, Jose Ferrer as King Herrod, John Wayne as the Centurion, Sidney Poitier as Simon of Cyrene, Telly Savalas as Pontius Pilate and Angela Lansbury as Claudia. Combining stellar performances, lavish sets, stunning locations and costing in excess of $20 million dollars, the story is true to the pages of the Gospel, earning five Academy Award nominations to become an enduring and revered classic.

results.title: The Prince of tides
results.creator_credit: Barbra Streisand, Andrew S Karsch, Longfellow, Barwood Films and Columbia
results.brief_description: New York psychiatrist, Susan Lowenstein (Barbra Streisand) confronts her own private pain when she delves into Tom Wingo’s (Nick Nolte) memories of his family’s past. Together they search for the key that may save Tom’s twin sister who repeatedly attempts suicide. Nick Nolte gives the most heartfelt and powerful performance of his career as a man who, in order to mend his sister’s emotional wounds, must finally come to terms with his own. Based on the best-selling novel by Pat Conroy and nominated for seven Academy Awards, this film is a compelling exploration of love - between men and women, parents and children, and, ultimately, love of oneself.

results.title: Misery
results.creator_credit: Rob Reiner, Andrew Scheinman, Nelson Entertainment and Castle Rock
results.brief_description:
He was a writer. She was his “Number One Fan”. She pulled him out of a car wreck, brought him home, splint and set his mangled legs. All Paul Sheldon had to do in return was write a very special book, just for her, all about her favourite character from his novels. One he had killed off and has to bring back to life. Now he not only has to write to save his character’s life, but he also has to write to save his own. James Caan is brilliant as the Gothic novellist who wants to change his genre and Kathy Bates, in her 1990 Best Actress Academy Award winning-role, is perfect as the obsessed fan who only wants to save her favourite character, even if it means killing the person who created it!
Cast also includes: Lauren Bacall, Richard Farnsworth

results.title: Village of the damned
results.creator_credit: Wolf Rilla, Ronald Kinnoch and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: From its seemingly placid opening, this tale of an ordinary British village facing an extraordinary foe keeps piling one eerie and disquieting detail upon another, creating an utterly believable masterpiece of horror. The trouble begins when, one normal day a strange supernatural force makes everybody in the village unconscious. When the villagers come to they they find that every capable woman in the village is pregnant. However, all the children are born on the same day and they all look alike - platinum-blonde hair, piercing eyes and the ability to read the unformed thoughts of human beings. Their rapid physical development is matched by their fast-growing mental powers and with calm, blood-curdling efficiency, they are soon terrorising the tiny hamlet - climaxing in an ending which has long-lasting ramifications on the use and misuse of scientific knowledge. Based on the novel “The Midwich cuckoos” by John Wyndham.

results.title: Rumble Fish
results.creator_credit: Francis Ford Coppola, Doug Claybourne, Fred Roos and Zoetrope Studios
results.brief_description: Academy Award winning director Francis Ford Coppola’s visually stunning adaptation of the S.E. Hinton novel. Starring teen heart-throbs Matt Dillon and Mickey Rourke as two brothers whose desire to break out of their urban trap eventually leads to death for one and a new beginning for the other. Photographed in black and white with colour sequences, this striking production features a brilliant supporting cast including Dennis Hopper and boasts a musical score by Stewart Copeland.

results.title: Westworld
results.creator_credit: Michael Crichton, Paul N Lazarus III and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Set in the not too distant future, this is a vision of what may occur if man becomes too reliant on the infallibility of machines.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Crichton, Paul N Lazarus III and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.description: Westworld combines solid entertainment and chilling topicality with a futuristic, suspenseful plot written by Michael Chrichton. Set in the not too distant future, this is a vision of what may occur if man becomes too reliant on the infallibility of machines. Westworld is one of three giant theme parks built in what is left of America’s great outdoors where for $1,000 a day, tourists may indulge their highest and lowest appetites. Richard Benjamin and James Brolin are among the visitors to the futuristic theme park where the gun-hands and dance-hall girls are robots programmed to serve the guest’s whims and fantasises until something malfunctions in their circuitry. Yul Brynner delivers a remarkably eerie performance as a robot cowboy who develops a taste for the kill.
